awd_titl_txt: COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH: Structural Analysis, U-Pb           Geochronologic, and Nd Isotopic Characterization of the     Carolina Slate Belt and Milton Belt, Southern Appalachians
awd_abstract_narration: The amalgamation of crustal and oceanic lithospheric                          fragments along continental margins represents a fundamental                    process for the growth of the continents.  The southern                         Appalachian Mountains are a product of such an amalgamation                     that occurred during Paleozoic-Mesozoic time.  This project                     will determine the structure, timing, and nature of the                         fragments that comprise the Carolina Slate Belt and Milton                      Belt using a combined field and laboratory approach.                            Results will have important implications for both the                           evolution of continents and for the development of most                         major mountain belt systems of the world.
